title: Foundations of Discrete Mathematics: Mastering Core Concepts Through Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment combining mobile learning with weekly intensive offline sessions using digital devices

learning_goals: Students can apply and explain the basic set operations (union, intersection, difference) to real-life cases.
Students can analyze the logical structure of propositions and construct truth tables.
Students can model simple network problems using graph theory.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
